reviews.text:
This railway station, at Whitchurch, has its own reasonably sized car park (some of which is tarmacked, but some of it just seems to be gravel in places). Maybe anything from about 25 to 35 cars could comfortably park here (and there are five spaces for disabled parking as well).

The railway station itself has two platforms (one for trains heading towards Shrewsbury, and one for trains heading towards Crewe and beyond). There is a bicycle rack on the Crewe bound platform which can accommodate about three bicycles. 

The station does have covered passenger sheltered areas on both platforms (where seating is also provided).

There is a self-service ticket machine which sits on the Crewe bound platform.

There are no staff on site, but at least there are real time digital displays of trains that are due to arrive in the near future.

Not old trains stop at Whitchurch railway station, but the ones that do stop at Whitchurch tend to have only one railway carriage, although this is not always the case.

There are no obvious signs of CCTV cameras in and around the station car park. 

The railway station car park is also the location of a bus stop where buses depart from there every now and then. There are two bus services that run to / from Whitchurch railway station car park, but they only seem to arrive (or depart) upto four times in a day (and there are no bus services on Sunday at all).
In need of some serious updating
